meanings.definition: To administer a vaccine to (a person or animal)
meanings.sent1: The nurse vaccinated the children to protect them from getting sick.
meanings.sent2: The doctor vaccinated the puppy to prevent it from catching any illnesses.
meanings.sent3: The superhero vaccinated all the citizens in the city to shield them from evil viruses.
meanings.sent4: The teacher vaccinated the classroom with knowledge to help them excel in their studies.
meanings.sent5: The gardener vaccinated the plants with nutrients to help them grow strong and healthy.

meanings.definition: Having received a vaccine to provide immunity against a disease.
meanings.sent1: The vaccinated individuals were safe from the contagious flu going around.
meanings.sent2: She felt relieved knowing she was vaccinated against the dangerous virus.
meanings.sent3: The vaccinated cat proudly showed off its immunity badge to the other pets.
meanings.sent4: The vaccinated team stood strong against the disease, like an impenetrable fortress.
meanings.sent5: The vaccinated community was like a shield, protecting each other from harm.
